Description: Upper body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved at rim (most lost), glazed streaky black below; below, part of lotus flower with trace of added red centre and added white outline; below, red dot and part of white rosette petal; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of a lion (tip of tail above on left, body with two red patches and mane remaining), to right.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 287, no. 841, pl. 117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1049) (phase 2)
